Replace.Text: Can escort other units to move together.
Can move blocks in ice areas.
Yoshino is holding a funny-looking rabbit hand puppet. Another personality created by her will only emerge when wearing the hand puppet.

Units will not take damage from Blizzard. Belligerents take double blizzard damage in imperial territory. Get a frozen golem in the capital. [NEWLINE] If the suzerain country is not Yoshino, unlock the construction of icebreakers, but the movement of all units [ICON_Movement] -1.

Yoshino is holding a funny-looking rabbit hand puppet. Another personality created by her will only emerge when wearing the hand puppet. It was Yoshino's ideal self and her friend. But if I didn't notice the loss of the hand puppet, it didn't seem to affect the appearance of Yoshino's personality.

Raids and official wars cannot be declared; other civs can only declare {LOC_LIBERATION_WAR_NAME}, {LOC_RECONQUEST_WAR_NAME}, {LOC_PROTECTORATE_WAR_NAME}, {LOC_EMERGENCY_WAR_NAME} and {LOC_HOLY_WAR_NAME} against you. When you disperse the barbarian outposts, you will receive tribal village rewards and experience points. All cities are created with an additional production cost of the lowest downtown building. Each city can build one more district than usual. When the professional area outside the municipal square is built, it has a certain chance to include the building that is currently buildable and has the lowest production cost in the area. [NEWLINE]Units cannot be damaged by blizzards. Belligerents take double blizzard damage in imperial territory. Areas and wonders can be built on ice. Snow, frozen soil, snowy hills, frozen hills +1 [ICON_Food] food. Allows building farms on tundra landforms, and unlocks "Civil Engineering" to build farms on tundra hills. Citizens can improve snow and tundra mountains. The snow and tundra mountains units provide +1 [ICON_Production] production and +1 [ICON_Faith] faith value. Each snow and tundra mountains unit in the origin city will be Domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route +1 [ICON_Faith] faith value, doubled after the industrial age. The cost of buying tiles on snow, tundra, snow hills, tundra hills, snow mountains, and tundra mountains is halved.

Warring civilizations gain double war exhaustion sentiment. Whenever you are not at war with any civilization, your city gets +10% [ICON_Production] production, and the capital's snow, tundra, snow hills, tundra hills terrain gets extra [ICON_Production] production. The current region gains an additional standard adjacency bonus when adjacent to another region. [NEWLINE]Gain a random [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Apocalypse when entering a new age. [NEWLINE]

Except for "Shenwei Lingzhuang Four Fans", whenever you do not have a war with any civilization, your city +10% [ICON_Science] technology value and [ICON_Culture] culture value. [ICON_Movement] Movement of all units of the civilization at war -1.

Except for "Shenwei Spiritual Equipment - Four Fans", the [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] resentment and belligerence for declaring a raid war are the same as the official war. Cities do not generate war weariness. Conquered cities do not lose [ICON_Citizen] population. [NEWLINE]All units have an additional +4 [ICON_Strength] combat power against barbarians, and each military policy has an additional +1 [ICON_Strength] combat power.

Except for "Shenwei Lingzhuang·Fan", each enters an era +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route, all cities have trade posts at the beginning, and cities within the capital trade route distance of [ICON_Capital] automatically open trade routes.

In addition to "Shenwei Lingzhuang Four Fans", the game is located in the ocean cell at the beginning, land units can board ships and have the ability to enter the ocean cell, and pioneers can build cities in the sea area. +2 [ICON_Science] technology value and +2 [ICON_Culture] culture value every round before opening up the first city. [NEWLINE]No flood damage.

In addition to "Shenwei Lingzhuang Four Fans", the [ICON_Loyalty] loyalty coefficient of the citizens of the home city increases, and the allies get part of the benefits, and the [ICON_Loyalty] loyalty coefficient of the citizens of the foreign cities decreases, and the effect of the enemy city is doubled. [NEWLINE]If the cities of other civilizations leave the civilization due to the decrease of [ICON_Loyalty] loyalty, and each round has the highest [ICON_Loyalty] loyalty to you, the city will directly skip the free city stage and directly join your civilization.
Except for "Shenwei Spiritual Clothes: Four Fans", it has all the characteristics of changing Yoshino.

If he would be branded a belligerent because of this war, he would never declare war and try to help those who keep the peace. Hate militants. [NEWLINE]Focus on defending city-state wars. Admire civilizations that wage wars to defend city-states. Dislikes civilizations that attack city-states.

Likes civilizations with great military power and tries to ally with them to avoid war. Dislikes civilizations with weak arms. [NEWLINE]Likes civilizations that don't interact with city-states. Hates city-state suzerains, or civilizations that conquer city-states.
Bingyachuan Yoshito is a characteristic support unit. [NEWLINE]All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced movement.

The Ice Megawa Yoshito is a unique Ancient Era support unit that replaces the Battering Ram. [NEWLINE]All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced movement. [NEWLINE]When approaching an enemy city, attacking melee and anti-cavalry units can deal full damage to the city walls. [NEWLINE]Does not affect cities with medieval or renaissance walls. Ineffective against city defenses.

The Ice Nagegawa Yoshito is a unique Medieval support unit that replaces the Siege Tower. [NEWLINE]All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced movement. [NEWLINE]When approaching an enemy city, attacking melee and anti-cavalry units ignore the walls and attack the city directly. [NEWLINE]Does not affect cities with Renaissance walls. Ineffective against city defenses.

Bingyachuan Yoshito is a characteristic Renaissance support unit. [NEWLINE]All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced movement. [NEWLINE]Attacks from adjacent melee and anti-cavalry units deal full damage to city walls.

The Ice Megawa Yoshito is a unique modern support unit that replaces the Observation Balloon. [NEWLINE]All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced movement. [NEWLINE]Attacks from adjacent melee and anti-cavalry units deal full damage to city walls. [NEWLINE]Gives +1 [ICON_Range] range to siege units within 1 cell.

The Hikagawa Yoshito is a unique Atomic Age AA support unit that replaces the AA Gun. [NEWLINE]All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced movement. [NEWLINE]Attacks from adjacent melee and anti-cavalry units deal full damage to city walls. [NEWLINE]+1[ICON_Range] range and +5[ICON_Bombard] bombardment attack for siege units within 1 cell. [NEWLINE]Provides cover for units within a tile from air strikes.

Hikagawa Yoshito is a characteristic air defense support unit in the information age, replacing the anti-aircraft missile vehicle. [NEWLINE]All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced movement. [NEWLINE]Attacks from adjacent melee and anti-cavalry units deal full damage to city walls. [NEWLINE]+1[ICON_Range] range and +5[ICON_Bombard] bombardment attack for siege units within 1 cell. [NEWLINE]If other units start moving from the surroundings, they gain 1 [ICON_Movement] movement bonus. [NEWLINE]Provides cover for units within one tile from air strikes and nuclear attacks.
Attacks from adjacent melee units and anti-cavalry units do full damage to the city walls.
Reversed Yoshito is a featured support unit. [NEWLINE]Ability to apply zone of control influence. All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] movement and [ICON_Strength] combat strength decreased.

The Reverse Yoshitaka is a unique Ancient Era support unit that replaces the Battering Ram. [NEWLINE]Ability to apply zone of control influence. All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] move down, -5 [ICON_Strength] combat power. [NEWLINE]When approaching an enemy city, attacking melee and anti-cavalry units can deal full damage to the city walls. [NEWLINE]Does not affect cities with medieval or renaissance walls. Ineffective against city defenses.

The Reverse Yoshito is a unique Medieval support unit that replaces the Siege Tower. [NEWLINE]Ability to apply zone of control influence. All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] move down, -5 [ICON_Strength] combat power. [NEWLINE]When approaching an enemy city, attacking melee and anti-cavalry units ignore the walls and attack the city directly. [NEWLINE]Does not affect cities with Renaissance walls. Ineffective against city defenses.

Reverse Yoshito is a unique Renaissance support unit. [NEWLINE]Ability to apply zone of control influence. All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] move down, -5 [ICON_Strength] combat power. [NEWLINE]Attacks from adjacent melee and anti-cavalry units deal full damage to city walls.

The Reverse Yoshito is a unique Modern support unit that replaces the Observation Balloon. [NEWLINE]Ability to apply zone of control influence. All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] move down, -5 [ICON_Strength] combat power. [NEWLINE]Attacks from adjacent melee and anti-cavalry units deal full damage to city walls. [NEWLINE]Gives +1 [ICON_Range] range to siege units within 1 cell.

The Reverse Yoshito is a unique Atomic Age AA support unit that replaces the AA Gun. [NEWLINE]Ability to apply zone of control influence. All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced mobility and -10 [ICON_Strength] combat power. [NEWLINE]Attacks from adjacent melee and anti-cavalry units deal full damage to city walls. [NEWLINE]+1[ICON_Range] range and +5[ICON_Bombard] bombardment attack for siege units within 1 cell. [NEWLINE]Provides cover for units within a tile from air strikes.

The Reverse Yoshito is a unique information age air defense support unit that replaces the anti-aircraft missile vehicle. [NEWLINE]Ability to apply zone of control influence. All adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] have reduced mobility and -10 [ICON_Strength] combat power. [NEWLINE]Attacks from adjacent melee and anti-cavalry units deal full damage to city walls. [NEWLINE]+1[ICON_Range] range and +5[ICON_Bombard] bombardment attack for siege units within 1 cell. [NEWLINE]If other units start moving from the surroundings, they gain 1 [ICON_Movement] movement bonus. [NEWLINE]Provides cover for units within one tile from air strikes and nuclear attacks.
+1 [ICON_Movement] movement; all adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] movement decreased.
Bingyachuan Yoshito is a characteristic support unit. It can move in blocks in the ice area, and can escort other units to move together.
Swimsuit Yoshito is a featured support unit. It can move in blocks in the ice area, and can escort other units to move together.
Reversed Yoshito is a featured support unit. It can move in blocks in the ice area, and can escort other units to move together.
Reversed Yoshito is a featured support unit. It can move in blocks in the ice area, and can escort other units to move together.
The Ice Armor Shishi is a unique medieval anti-armor unit that replaces the Spearman. [NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if adjacent to at least 1 Heavy Armor unit.

The Reverse Yoshito is a unique medieval anti-armor unit that replaces the Spearmen. [NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if adjacent to at least 1 Heavy Armor unit. [NEWLINE]Each adjacent recruited unit gives it +3 [ICON_Strength] combat strength.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Heavy Armor nearby.
+{1_Amount}[ICON_Strength] combat strength when adjacent to another armored soldier
Shishi Shishi is a characteristic Renaissance anti-armor unit, replacing the spear and shooting phalanx. [NEWLINE]Move faster. Has a high flank attack bonus.

The Reversed Yoshino is a unique Renaissance anti-armor unit that replaces the Jab and Shooting Phalanx. [NEWLINE]Move faster. Has a high flank attack bonus. Each point of unused [ICON_Movement] movement power will provide +3 [ICON_Strength] combat strength.
The Swimsuit Yoshito is a unique Industrial Age melee unit that replaces the Battle Infantry. [NEWLINE]Disembarking does not cost movement.
[ICON_Bullet] No [ICON_Movement] movement is consumed when disembarking.

The Reverse Yoshito is a unique Industrial Age melee unit that replaces the Battle Infantry. [NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other than your own capital. Disembarking does not consume movement power.

The Witch Yoshino is a unique Industrial Era light cavalry unit that replaces cavalry. [NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or near territory. If there is remaining [ICON_Movement] movement power, you can move after attacking.

The Reversed Yoshino is a unique Industrial Era light cavalry unit that replaces cavalry. [NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or near territory. If there is remaining [ICON_Movement] movement power, it can move after attacking and provide +3 [ICON_Strength] combat power.

The Frozen Golem characteristic area, which replaces the community, can only be built in snow, tundra, snow hills, tundra hills, and provides the above-mentioned terrain [ICON_Production] production gain. Provides additional entertainment value with civic evolution, but cannot be built in cities with "Recreation Centers" or "Water Parks". [NEWLINE]{LOC_DISTRICT_NEIGHBORHOOD_DESCRIPTION}

Bingyachuan Sishi is a characteristic building. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction. +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value for each adjacent tundra, tundra hills, snow and snow hills cells. After unlocking the "flying" technology, you can get [ICON_Tourism] tourism performance from the cultural value. +2 [ICON_Food] food and [ICON_Production] productivity after unlocking the "Professional Sports" civic. +4 [ICON_Culture] culture value if it is adjacent to a stadium or aquatic center building. Can be built on Tundra, Tundra Hills, Snow and Snow Hills. +2 [ICON_Appeal] Charisma.

Reversed Four Lines is a characteristic building. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction. +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value for each adjacent tundra, tundra hills, snow and snow hills cells. After unlocking the "flying" technology, you can get [ICON_Tourism] tourism performance from the cultural value. +2 [ICON_Food] food and [ICON_Production] productivity after unlocking the "Professional Sports" civic. +4 [ICON_Culture] culture value if it is adjacent to a stadium or aquatic center building. Can be built on Tundra, Tundra Hills, Snow and Snow Hills. +3 [ICON_Appeal] Charisma. The movement of adjacent enemy units [ICON_Movement] decreases.

Frozen Golem Feature Improvement. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Provide 1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction point. [NEWLINE]Gives [ICON_Tourism] tourism credits equal to [ICON_Gold] gold production. [NEWLINE]Can only be built on mountains (plains, grasslands, snow, tundra). Cannot be built next to other ski resorts, nor can it be looted, improved or removed.
